Most Illustrious Sir

Insurmountable inconveniences have delayed our operations in Rio Grande, and the occupation of the capital by the insurgents, depriving us of the resources that came to us from there through supply and war, has greatly saddened the patriots, to see in the armed citizens a suffering beyond expectation, and that this may be limited if the circumstances do not promptly improve.

The apologists of the opposing party have opened their treasuries to their followers, who lack nothing, and this disproportion will be enough to change the face of our affairs in a moment. Such considerations have compelled Your Excellency Sir Your Lordship to one thousand five hundred patacões, which I do hereby, for I cannot abandon another matter of equal importance; assuring Your Lordship

By the bearer, Sir, Your Lordship will send

God keep Your Lordship Pelotas, July 22, 1836. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Domingos José de Almeida Colonel Chief of Legion.

Public Service. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. From the Colonel Chief of the Legion of the District of Rio Grande.
